meanings.definition: A standard or point of reference against which things may be compared or assessed.
meanings.sent1: The teacher used the benchmark to compare the students' progress.
meanings.sent2: The company set a new benchmark for customer service excellence.
meanings.sent3: The benchmark for the best pizza in town is the one with the most cheese.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her craft became the benchmark for success in the industry.
meanings.sent5: The benchmark of a true friend is someone who is always there for you.

meanings.definition: A surveyor's mark made on a stationary object of known position and elevation, used as a reference point.
meanings.sent1: The surveyor placed a benchmark on the building to measure its height.
meanings.sent2: The benchmark on the hill helped the hikers find their way back.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the benchmark for a nut and tried to bury it.
meanings.sent4: The benchmark on the map guided the explorers through the dense forest.
meanings.sent5: The benchmark on the rock was a crucial reference point for the construction project.
